title: Biden Launches Emergency Media Offensive
sub_head: Amid the Afghanistan debacle, the president faces a new press environment.
body:
The emerging disaster in Afghanistan has forced the president to cut short a trip to Camp David and respond to a suddenly aggressive press corps. Amid scenes of desperate Afghans trying to climb aboard departing U.S. aircraft and reports of a number of deaths at the chaotic Kabul airport, the president is returning to the White House, where he plans to deliver remarks in the East Room at 3:45 p.m. ET on Monday. For the first time in his presidency, he cannot count on a generally amicable media reception.
Scott Whitlock of NewsBusters writes:
Perhaps media folk are upset at being misled last month in the East Room when Mr. Biden offered a picture of the situation in Afghanistan that has proven to be entirely false. Speaking of Afghan interpreters and others who assisted U.S. forces, Mr. Biden told reporters that “our message to those women and men is clear: There is a home for you in the United States if you so choose, and we will stand with you just as you stood with us.” It’s now clear that many of our friends are standing alone and in grave danger, trapped inside the country now ruled by the Taliban.
